div.head: 損血
div.div: bleeding from an injury to harm the blood blood resulting from an injury

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: bleeding from an injury to harm the blood blood resulting from an injury

sense.def: ① Pathological Condition of a shang sun 傷損 , injury, with blood spitting and blood discharge. Qian jin yi fang 千金翼方 7 ：大補益當歸丸，治產後虛羸不足…或損血吐下及金瘡等方 , “The pills with dang gui for massive supplementation, they are a recipe to cure depletion following delivery, with emaciation and insufficiency…and also bleeding resulting from injury , as well as wounds inflicted by metal objects”.

② Pathological Mechanism of pathological changes undergone by the blood inside the body resulting from various causes. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 30: 虛勞損血，則不能榮養於筋 , “When depletion exhaustion harms the blood , it will no longer be able to nourish the sinews”. ③ Pathological Product identical with sun yu 損瘀 , blood that has left the vessels following an injury. Wai tai mi yao 外台秘要 17: 卒然損傷於腰而致痛也，此由損血搏於背脊所為 , “If a person has been suddenly injured in the lower back and feels pain there, the reason is that the blood resulting from the injury is striking against the spine and back”.
